text:
SARAH LUCAS: Hello,
this is Sarah Lucas.

I'm here to walk you through
the Test Scores section.

As you can see right at the
top of the Test Scores section,

a GMAT or GRE score is required
to submit your application.

One of the biggest
misconceptions

about applying to HBS is
that admissions decisions

are based largely on
your GMAT or GRE score.
That is just not how it works.

We evaluate test scores in the
context of all the other parts

of your application, and
consider every element

of your background
and experience

to get to know you
as a whole person.

You can see from
the class profile

that we admit students with a
wide range of GMAT and GRE test
scores.

Each year, we are
looking to craft

a class of diverse
thinkers and leaders

who will make a
difference in the world,

and that goes well beyond
a GRE or GMAT score.

So why do we require
standardized tests at all?

A standardized test
gives us one indication

of your verbal and
quantitative agility.

Both are important for
thriving in the HBS MBA program
and in the case method.

We are entirely agnostic
about the GMAT or the GRE.

Please take whichever
test suits you best.

Please submit whichever one
gives you a higher test score.

Please pay attention to the
valid test score dates listed
at the top of the section.

We can only accept valid test
scores from the past five years
for verification reasons.

You may also submit unofficial
GMAT or GRE test scores

as long as an official score
report, when available,
is sent to HBS.

Just be sure to make note
of that unofficial score
before you wrap up the test.

Finally, although you
may take the GMAT and/or

GRE multiple times, you
may report only one score--
either a GMAT or a GRE--
not both.

The HBS MBA program is built
upon an immersive learning

experience that requires public
speaking, group discussions,
and active class participation.

To thrive in the academic
environment at HBS,

students must possess a
highly developed proficiency
in English.

Therefore, we require
candidates who

receive their bachelor's
degree and any graduate degrees

from a university
where English was not

the sole language of
instruction to submit a score
from an English language test.

Note that your requirement to
submit an English test score

is not based on
your citizenship.

Please see the International
Applicants portion

of our website for more
details on these three tests

and our guidance surrounding
English test scores.

For more information, visit
our Application Process page,
and good luck.
